comments: I am getting the following exception when rose class model has associations between top-level and nested classes (will attach sample model shortly). I am using Eclipse 3.2.1 and EMF 2.2.1.

Created an attachment (id=51492)
sample Rose class model

Steps to reproduce

* Open New EMF project wizard
* Select "Rose class model" model importer
* Load attached emftest.mdl
* Select both Package1 and Package2 root packages

Problem: cannot proceed with EMF project creation and the exception below is logged in .log

Created an attachment (id=51500)
Browser and class diagram in Rose 98

Hi Igor, 

I believe this is a problem in the mdl file itself.  You either have a corrupted model or are using a Rose that we don't support (EMF uses Rose98). I've attached here the image of your model that I got using Rose 98.  Notice that the data in the browser and in the diagram are not related at all.  The former shows a package "Package2" with a class "Outer" and the latter implies that I should be seeing a package "Outer" with a class "Nested".

If this is a Rose version issue, check if you can do a "Save as Rose 98" or something like it.

I am returning this bug as invalid.

Ok, I understand now that EMF does not support more recent versions of Rose and it cannot model nested classes (which is the real problem for me). Still, there are couple of really small changes that would make importing Rose models in EMF a more pleasant experience.

First, it is not that obvious that EMF can only import Rose 98 models. I got no warning about incompatible MDL version, nor I could find information about supported Rose versions in any document I could think of (Help, Readme, online documentation and FAQ). If you just renamed model importer to "Rose'98 class model" this would have saved me a lot of time.

Second, instead of silently dumping exception to .log file, EMF should make it obvlious that there were troubles interpreting the rose model. 

Just my 2 kopeks.
